DOC.brief_summary: The objective of this study is to determine whether the use of a mix of dairy lipids and plant oils in infant formula can increase the sum of omega-3 fatty acids levels in membrane phospholipids of red blood cells (RBC) in 4 month-old infants compared with a formula containing only lipids of plant origin.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of a Mix of Dairy Lipids and Plant Oils in Infant Formula on Omega-3 Fatty Acid in Red Blood Cells
DOC.criteria: Full term healthy newborn from normal pregnancy Newborn whose mother decided to not breastfeed or to stop breastfeed before the third week of life Newborn with lowbirthweight (<2500 g) Newborn whose parents have planned a move within 6 months after birth Family history of allergy to milk protein
